intro: Dorstenia benguellensis, commonly known as the East African devil's backbone, is a striking member of the family Moraceae. It is native to the highlands of eastern Africa, including countries like Tanzania and Kenya. The plant is characterized by its unique, spiraling stems that resemble a twisted backbone, along with its small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, a feature common in the genus Dorstenia. The plant thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found growing in rocky or forested areas.
